an5.131:4.1: “Mendicants, possessing five factors a wheel-turning monarch wields power only in a principled manner.
an5.131:4.2: And this power cannot be undermined by any human enemy.
an5.131:5.2: A wheel-turning monarch knows what is right, knows principle, knows moderation, knows the right time, and knows the assembly.
an5.131:5.3: A wheel-turning monarch who possesses these five factors wields power only in a principled manner.
an5.131:5.4: And this power cannot be undermined by any human enemy.
an5.131:6.1: In the same way, possessing five factors a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha rolls forth the supreme Wheel of Dharma only in a principled manner.
an5.131:6.2: And that wheel cannot be rolled back by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.
an5.131:7.2: A Realized One knows what is right, knows principle, knows moderation, knows the right time, and knows the assembly.
an5.131:7.3: Possessing these five factors a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha rolls forth the supreme Wheel of Dharma only in a principled manner.
an5.131:7.4: And that wheel cannot be rolled back by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.”
